TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DurableTaskOptions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Configuration options for the Durable Task extension.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: To be added.
If UseAppLease is true, gets or sets the AppLeaaseOptions used for acquiring the lease to start the application.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.AzureStorageConnectionStringName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Azure Storage connection string used to manage the underlying Azure Storage resources.
Docs.value: The name of a connection string that exists in the app's application settings.
Docs.remarks: If not specified, the default behavior is to use the standard `AzureWebJobsStorage` connection string for all storage usage.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ControlQueueBatchSize : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of messages to pull from the control queue at a time.
Docs.value: A positive integer configured by the host. The default value is 32.
Docs.remarks: Messages pulled from the control queue are buffered in memory until the internal dispatcher is ready to process them.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ControlQueueVisibilityTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the visibility timeout of dequeued control queue messages.
Docs.value: A TimeSpan configured by the host. The default is 5 minutes.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type name of a custom to use for handling lifecycle notification events.
Docs.value: Assembly qualified class name that implements ILifeCycleNotificationHelper.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EntityMessageReorderWindowInMinutes : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the time window within which entity messages get deduplicated and reordered.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventGridKeySettingName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the app setting containing the key used for authenticating with the Azure Event Grid custom topic at .
Docs.value: The name of the app setting that stores the Azure Event Grid key.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventGridPublishEventTypes : string[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the event types that will be published to Event Grid.
Docs.value: A list of strings. Possible values include 'Started', 'Completed', 'Failed', 'Terminated'.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventGridPublishRetryCount : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Event Grid publish request retry count.
Docs.value: The number of retry attempts.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventGridPublishRetryHttpStatus : int[] with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Event Grid publish request http status.
Docs.value: A list of HTTP status codes, e.g. 400, 403.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventGridPublishRetryInterval : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets orsets the Event Grid publish request retry interval.
Docs.value: A representing the retry interval. The default value is 5 minutes.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.EventGridTopicEndpoint : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the URL of an Azure Event Grid custom topic endpoint. When set, orchestration life cycle notification events will be automatically published to this endpoint.
Docs.value: The Azure Event Grid custom topic URL.
Docs.remarks: Azure Event Grid topic URLs are generally expected to be in the form https://{topic_name}.{region}.eventgrid.azure.net/api/events.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ExtendedSessionIdleTimeoutInSeconds : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the amount of time in seconds before an idle session times out. The default value is 30 seconds.
Docs.value: The number of seconds before an idle session times out.
Docs.remarks: This setting is applicable when is set to true.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.ExtendedSessionsEnabled : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether to enable extended sessions.
Docs.value: true to enable extended sessions; otherwise false.

remarks.para: Extended sessions can improve the performance of orchestrator functions by allowing them to skip replays when new messages are received within short periods of time.

Note that orchestrator functions which are extended this way will continue to count against the limit. To avoid starvation, only half of the maximum number of allowed concurrent orchestrator functions can be concurrently extended at any given time. The property can also be used to control how long an idle orchestrator function is allowed to be extended.
It is recommended that this property be set to false during development to help ensure that the orchestrator code correctly obeys the idempotency rules.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.FetchLargeMessagesAutomatically : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the extension will automatically download large inputs and outputs in orchestration status queries. If set to false, the extension will instead return a blob storage url pointing to the GZip compressed input or output data.
Docs.value: A boolean indicating whether will automatically download large orchestration inputs and outputs when fetching orchestration status.

Docs.summary: Settings used for Durable HTTP functionality.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.HubName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets default task hub name to be used by all , , , , and instances.
Docs.value: The name of the default task hub.
Docs.remarks: A task hub is a logical grouping of storage resources. Alternate task hub names can be used to isolate multiple Durable Functions applications from each other, even if they are using the same storage backend.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property LocalRpcEndpointEnabled As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.LocalRpcEndpointEnabled : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable the local RPC endpoint managed by this extension.
Docs.value: To be added.
Docs.remarks:
The local RPC endpoint is intended to allow out-of-process functions to make direct calls into this extension. This is primarily intended to support instance management APIs used by the durable client binding. The following values are allowed:
null(Default) The local RPC endpoint is enabled only for non-.NET function apps.
trueA local RPC endpoint will be enabled and listen at http://127.0.0.1:17071/durabletask/.
falseThe local RPC endpoint will be disabled.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.LogReplayEvents : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets if logs for replay events need to be recorded.
Docs.value: Boolean value specifying if the replay events should be logged.
Docs.remarks: The default value is false, which disables the logging of replay events.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxConcurrentActivityFunctions As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxConcurrentActivityFunctions : Nullable<int> with get, set
member this.MaxConcurrentActivityFunctions : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of activity functions that can be processed concurrently on a single host instance.
Docs.value: A positive integer configured by the host.
Docs.remarks: Increasing activity function concurrent can result in increased throughput but can also increase the total CPU and memory usage on a single worker instance.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxConcurrentOrchestratorFunctions As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxConcurrentOrchestratorFunctions : Nullable<int> with get, set
member this.MaxConcurrentOrchestratorFunctions : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of orchestrator functions that can be processed concurrently on a single host instance.
Docs.value: A positive integer configured by the host.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property MaxEntityOperationBatchSize As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.MaxEntityOperationBatchSize : Nullable<int> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of entity operations that are processed as a single batch.
Docs.value: A positive integer configured by the host.
Docs.remarks: Reducing this number can help to avoid timeouts on consumption plans. If set to 1, batching is disabled, and each operation message executes and is billed as a separate function invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.MaxOrchestrationActions : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of orchestration actions. The default value is 100,000.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.MaxQueuePollingInterval : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum queue polling interval.
Docs.value: Maximum interval for polling control and work-item queues.

Docs.summary: The section of configuration related to notifications.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.NotificationUrl : Uri with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the base URL for the HTTP APIs managed by this extension.
Docs.value: A URL pointing to the hosted function app that responds to status polling requests.
Docs.remarks: This property is intended for use only by runtime hosts.

Docs.summary: States that will override an existing orchestrator when attempting to start a new orchestrator with the same instance Id.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.PartitionCount : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the partition count for the control queue.
Docs.value: A positive integer between 1 and 16. The default value is 4.
Docs.remarks: Increasing the number of partitions will increase the number of workers that can concurrently execute orchestrator functions. However, increasing the partition count can also increase the amount of load placed on the storage account and on the thread pool if the number of workers is smaller than the number of partitions.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.RollbackEntityOperationsOnExceptions : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Controls whether an uncaught exception inside an entity operation should roll back the effects of the operation.
Docs.value: To be added.
Docs.remarks: The rollback undoes all internal effects of an operation (sent signals, and state creation, deletion, or modification). However, it does not roll back external effects (such as I/O that was performed). This setting can affect serialization overhead: if true, the entity state is serialized after each individual operation. If false, the entity state is serialized only after an entire batch of operations completes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetDefaultHubName(string hubName) cil managed

Docs.param: TaskHub name that is considered the default.
Docs.summary: Sets HubName to a value that is considered a default value.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property StorageProvider As IDictionary(Of String, Object)
member this.StorageProvider : System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string, obj> with get, set

Docs.summary: The section of configuration related to storage providers. If using Azure Storage provider, the schema should match .
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TraceInputsAndOutputs : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to trace the inputs and outputs of function calls.
Docs.value: true to trace the raw values of inputs and outputs; otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: The default behavior when tracing function execution events is to include the number of bytes in the serialized inputs and outputs for function calls. This provides minimal information about what the inputs and outputs look like without bloating the logs or inadvertently exposing sensitive information to the logs. Setting to true will instead cause the default function logging to log the entire contents of function inputs and outputs.

Docs.summary: The section of configuration related to tracing.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TrackingStoreConnectionStringName : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Azure Storage connection string to use for the durable tracking store (History and Instances tables).
Docs.value: The name of a connection string that exists in the app's application settings.

remarks.para: If not specified, the connection string is used for the durable tracking store.

This property is primarily useful when deploying multiple apps that need to share the same tracking infrastructure. For example, when deploying two versions of an app side by side, using the same tracking store allows both versions to save history into the same table, which allows clients to query for instance status across all versions.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.TrackingStoreNamePrefix : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name prefix to use for history and instance tables in Azure Storage.
Docs.value: The prefix to use when naming the generated Azure tables.
Docs.remarks: This property is only used when is specified. If no prefix is specified, the default prefix value is "DurableTask".

MemberSignature.Value: member this.UseAppLease : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: If true, takes a lease on the task hub container, allowing for only one app to process messages in a task hub at a time.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.UseGracefulShutdown : bool with get, set

Docs.summary: Preview setting for gracefully shutting down to prevent WebJob shutdowns from failing activities or orchestrations.
Docs.value: To be added.

MemberSignature.Value: member this.WorkItemQueueVisibilityTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the visibility timeout of dequeued work item queue messages.
Docs.value: A TimeSpan configured by the host. The default is 5 minutes.
